intro: Isochilus chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It has lanceolate leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
